entry.title: Signature Blocks and URI Sign Requests
entry.summary: In an email sent on April 3rd, 2012 at 2:46:17 PM, Gavin Andresen expressed his belief that existing standards should be extended whenever possible to avoid reinventing the wheel. He also raised the question of whether it was possible to make signatures compatible with PGP/EC.This statement highlights Andresen's preference for building upon pre-existing standards rather than creating new ones from scratch. By doing so, he suggests that this approach could save time and resources while also ensuring compatibility with existing systems.Additionally, Andresen specifically mentions PGP/EC as a potential area for improvement. This refers to the Pretty Good Privacy (PGP) encryption software and Elliptic Curve (EC) cryptography, which are both widely used in digital security.Overall, Andresen's email suggests a thoughtful and pragmatic approach to innovation in the field of digital security. By leveraging existing standards and technologies, he advocates for a more efficient and effective way forward in developing new tools and systems.
